Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Thursday April 24), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for thursday, april 24th.

kicking things off with some big moves in the social media world, meta platforms is reportedly testing a premium-tier subscription for instagram and facebook users. the new service, which could be available by the end of the year, aims to offer an ad-free experience and exclusive features. meta is focusing on new revenue streams as it faces increasing competition from other platforms, such as tiktok.

in enterprise news, aws has announced a major investment to expand its cloud infrastructure in southeast asia. the company committed $6 billion over the next five years to enhance its data centers, highlighting the region's growing demand for cloud services. this move comes as microsoft and google have also been increasing their footprints in the fast-growing market.

meanwhile, shares of zoom video communications rallied today after the company unveiled its new ai-driven features for enhanced video conferencing. with tools like real-time language translation and automated meeting summaries, zoom aims to bolster its platform and capture a larger share of the post-pandemic remote work market. analysts have reacted positively, citing increased engagement from corporate clients.

finally, in the world of cybersecurity, palo alto networks has agreed to acquire cloud security startup seclynx for roughly $600 million. the acquisition is expected to strengthen palo alto's position in the cloud security landscape and enhance its offerings for hybrid cloud environments—an area of growing importance as more businesses adapt to remote and flexible work solutions.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, april 24th.

we start with a shake-up in the social media sphere. meta platforms is reportedly testing a premium-tier subscription for instagram and facebook. the service, which could launch by year-end, aims to provide users with an ad-free experience and exclusive features. this move is part of meta's strategy to explore new revenue streams amid rising competition from platforms like tiktok.

in enterprise developments, aws has unveiled plans to invest $6 billion in expanding its cloud infrastructure across southeast asia over the next five years. this investment underscores the region's escalating demand for cloud services. aws is not alone in this venture, as both microsoft and google have been ramping up their presence in this rapidly growing market.

meanwhile, shares of zoom video communications surged today following the company’s announcement of new ai-driven features for its video conferencing platform. among the innovations are real-time language translation and automated meeting summaries. these enhancements aim to strengthen zoom's appeal in the evolving remote work landscape. analysts are responding positively, noting heightened engagement from corporate clients.

in cybersecurity news, palo alto networks has reached a deal to acquire cloud security startup seclynx for approximately $600 million. this acquisition is set to enhance palo alto’s standing in the cloud security sector, particularly as more businesses shift to hybrid cloud environments to support remote and flexible work strategies.

that's all for today's coverage. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-264 Meta's Premium Move on Instagram & Facebook 🎉, Aws's $6b Cloud Expansion in Southeast Asia ☁️, Zoom's Ai Innovations 🚀
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, april 24th.

  • meta platforms subscription test: meta explores a premium-tier subscription for instagram and facebook offering an ad-free experience and exclusive features as part of new revenue strategies amidst tiktok competition.
  • aws investment in southeast asia: aws plans a $6 billion investment to expand its cloud infrastructure in southeast asia over five years, reflecting growing regional cloud service demand with similar efforts from microsoft and google.
  • zoom's ai-driven innovations: zoom shares rise after unveiling ai features like real-time language translation and automated meeting summaries to bolster its remote work platform, garnering positive analyst reactions.
  • palo alto networks acquisition: palo alto networks boosts its cloud security portfolio by acquiring seclynx for approximately $600 million, enhancing their hybrid cloud security capabilities for remote work environments.

that's all for today's coverage. we'll see you back here tomorrow.
